alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 11:06AM AKST until February 11 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING FROM BETHEL WEST... * WHAT...Blowing snow occurring. North-northeast winds of 25 to 30 mph with gusts to near 40 mph inland and up to 55 mph along the coast. Blowing snow combined with falling snow will reduce visibilities to one half mile or less at times. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 inches possible. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta from Bethel west. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of falling snow and wind gusts to 55 mph could produce intermittent blizzard conditions along the Kuskokwim Delta coast, with visibility dropping to one quarter mile or less at times. Conditions are expected to improve from south to north through the late afternoon and evening hours.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
